image.altText: Troy Bell looks serious while being filmed in camera

props.synopsis: Former South Australian MP Troy Bell, who was previously found guilty of serious fraud charges, is also facing a raft of deception allegations, it can be revealed.

title.children: Former SA MP charged over alleged misuse of accommodation allowance

image.altText: composite image of Vincent Tarzia on a stage, Troy Bell outdoors

props.synopsis: With the departure of Troy Bell this week, the South Australian Liberal Party had its sights set on finally winning a by-election. Instead, they were reminded of their 28-year political nightmare.

title.children: Mad Monday beers, a UK theatre fan and a 28-year Liberal Party nightmare

image.altText: A middle-aged man with a light, grey beard wears high-vis as he holds leaves hanging from a tree in his hands.

props.synopsis: Producers and beekeepers had been expecting the arrival of the parasite. Now they are bracing for impact.

title.children: Uncertainty for SA communities after first varroa mite detection

image.altText: Taylor Walker looks to evade a Darcy Moore tackle while running with the ball

props.synopsis: Taylor Walker has become one of the AFL's premier forwards, but in Broken Hill in 2007, spectators got a sneak peek of the future. Â

title.children: From the Bulldogs to the big time, Broken Hill celebrates Tex's 300th game

image.altText: Honeybees on a frame, beekeeper points a finger at the queen bee.

props.synopsis: The "world's worst" honey bee parasite, varroa mite, has been detected in South Australia for the first time. Now in five jurisdictions across Australia, what impact will it have on the agricultural industry?

title.children: A honey bee-killing parasite is in SA for the first time. What impact will it have?

image.altText: A small stone church with a wall at the front.

props.synopsis: A church in Mount Gambier that was set to become an Airbnb will again open its doors to the faithful after the Greek Orthodox Diocese of Adelaide purchased it.Â

title.children: Church to reopen for worship after 'divine intervention' nixes Airbnb plan

image.altText: New houses and land for sale at a housing development

props.synopsis: Housing affordability remains around record lows, despite recent rate cuts, but it is not stopping an above-average number of first-time buyers from entering the market, according to a new report.

title.children: Adelaide overtakes Sydney as the toughest market for first home buyers

image.altText: An aerial view of the pellet plant at the Whyalla steelworks

props.synopsis: The administrators of the Whyalla steelworks have had their ownership of the infrastructure on the port site confirmed by the Federal Court, paving the way for the steelworks to be sold as an integrated asset.

title.children: SA premier claims 'major victory' in dispute over Whyalla port ownership

image.altText: A pile of wine bottles

props.synopsis: New South Wales and South Australia will expand their 10-cent container deposit schemes to include wine, spirit, and some other large drink containers by late 2027.Â

title.children: Container deposit schemes to include wine, spirit bottles

image.altText: A close-up of the face of a greyish-brown elephant seal lounging in shallow water.

props.synopsis: Sammy the seal often pops up in the seaside Victorian town of Portland and has recently been photographed munching on a shark. He is loved by many, but authorities are warning people to keep their distance.

title.children: Shark-eating seal returns to Portland, prompting warnings for admirers

image.altText: SES volunteers in orange coveralls and other people near the banks of a very full dam surrounded by green grass

props.synopsis: Residents in the Adelaide Hills town of Echunga are being warned about a leaking dam which the SES says is at risk of failing and could cause water to flood nearby properties.

title.children: Water being siphoned out of Adelaide Hills dam at risk of failure

image.altText: Tomatoes on a supermarket shelf.

props.synopsis: After 12 months without income, three SA tomato growing businesses hit by an exotic virus have been given the green light to resume trading.

title.children: Tomato growers back in business after catastrophic virus outbreak

image.altText: A close up shot of a Maori carving laying down in a wooden crate.

props.synopsis: They depict MÄori ancestors, they have been described as cultural treasures, they are made from wood and shell â and they are now returning home after more than a century overseas.

title.children: 'Snapshot of MÄori past': Carvings handed back to descendants

image.altText: Janelle Cuthbertson ACL injury AFLW

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide has had five players recovering from knee reconstructions. The AFLW is just three rounds into the season, but has at least 15 players recovering from knee reconstructions.

title.children: Port Adelaide hit hard with five AFLW players recovering from ACL injuries

image.altText: A couple stand in an apartment looking into camera with a serious expression. One is holding a cat.

props.synopsis: A year after they moved into an "affordable" apartment in a new public-private housing development in inner Melbourne, Alix and Tiarn were told their rent would increase by 17 per cent. They say their experience highlights flaws in the model the Victorian government is using to redevelop its aging public housing towers.

title.children: 'Affordable' housing tenants face $55 per week rent increase

image.altText: Chinese flags fly high outside the Australian Parliament House in Canberra

props.synopsis: The concert was set to take place in the Great Hall of Parliament House and celebrate Japan's defeat in World War II, but it was blocked by Australian officials, sparking a diplomatic blame game.

title.children: 'Untenable' Chinese embassy concert in Parliament House stopped by officials

image.altText: A man in suit and tie stands outside a house in a black and white tv still.

props.synopsis: Michael Charlton, the inaugural host of the ABC's Four Corners program and Gold Logie Award winner, has died aged 98.

title.children: Michael Charlton, first host of Four Corners, dies aged 98

image.altText: Close up of elderly person's hand on a chair.

props.synopsis: Wednesday's announcement that the government would immediately fund more care packages for older Australians is "very significant", according to an independent aged care expert and former acting inspector general of aged care.

title.children: Extra aged care packages 'a good start', national peak body says

image.altText: A child's hands hold a tablet in a classroom

props.synopsis: Handing over identification documents or biometric screening â these are the barriers teens could face under the social media ban.

title.children: Upload passport, take a selfie: How teens could be screened for social media ban

image.altText: A woman in a red shirt and brown curly hair standing in a garden setting and looks into the distance

props.synopsis: After being exonerated for the deaths of her four infant children, Kathleen Folbigg is adjusting to life after 20 years wrongfully imprisoned â thanks to the enduring support of her lifelong friend and biggest advocate, Tracy Chapman.

title.children: How Kathleen Folbigg survived 20 years wrongfully imprisoned

image.altText: A group of men wearing black.

props.synopsis: A man will face court today charged with offences related to the attack on Camp Sovereignty over the weekend. Neo-Nazi leader Thomas Sewell is being held in custody over the incident.

title.children: More arrests over Camp Sovereignty attack that left multiple people injured

image.altText: A sign with the ad campaign tagline and a picture of sydney sweeney

props.synopsis: The ASX is following global markets with strong gains, while American Eagle shares surge in after-hours US trade amid the success of a controversial ad campaign featuring Sydney Sweeney. Follow the latest on our live markets blog.

title.children: ASX gains strongly, American Eagle shares surge on earnings update

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Australian dollar softer on bond market jitters
ASX opens solidly higher on Wall St, European gains

image.altText: Two photos one of a slim woman standing in a pharmacy, and another of the same women looking larger.

props.synopsis: Mary Baker became increasingly angry when she saw her image manipulated and doctored in an AI-generated weight-loss endorsement on social media.

title.children: Pharmacist shocked to see her AI-manipulated photo in weight loss ads

image.altText: Person carrying a duffel bag with passport and boarding pass in hand heading towards the airport

props.synopsis: Online travel agency Traveldream has gone into administration, leaving many customers out of pocket. We want to know if you have been impacted or have had a similar experience with a third-party travel agency.

title.children: Tell us if you have lost money to a third-party travel agent

image.altText: A blue board shows a photo of Epstein and Maxwell hugging, beside a series of dot-pointed text. A hand points to the photo..

props.synopsis: Interest in the 20-year-old case has exploded in recent months even as US President Donald Trump urged the public to move on from what he deems a "pretty boring" saga.Â

title.children: Amid fresh revelations, here are the key events in the Epstein saga

image.altText: Tony Burke at press conference

props.synopsis: The sight of neo-Nazis trying to whip up community anger and recruit new followers drove home to all how criticism of Australia's migration program can lead to and even legitimise hate speech, racism, and violence.

title.children: What's the cost of support for Australia's migration program? $408m and then some

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Thousands of investors who were exposed to heavy losses by investing their retirement savings into the First Guardian and Shield managed investment schemes have been told they may be able to get "remediation" from the superannuation trustees that ran platforms that housed their investments.

title.children: Thousands caught in First Guardian, Shield collapse told 'remediation' may be possible

image.altText: A photo of Bowen in profile, looking serious.

props.synopsis: The climate change minister says he will have to assess whether legislating the government's 2035 emissions target is politically feasible, with the major waypoint towards net zero due to be announced soon.

title.children: Bowen says political environment may prevent 2035 emissions target becoming law

image.altText: A man in his late 20s with dark brown hair, smiling, sitting in farming equipment

props.synopsis: When Luke Bateman was at the peak of his NRL career in 2019, his life outwardly exemplified the dream of many young Australian men, but the reality was much grimmer.

title.children: 'I couldn't buy groceries': Luke Bateman admits 'debilitating' gambling addiction

image.altText: Alex de Mianur playing a backhand tennis shot, with one hand, outstretched

props.synopsis: It is heartbreak for Alex de Minaur once again at the US Open, as the Australian fails to break through to the semifinals at a major for the first time in his career.

title.children: De Minaur's QF hoodoo strikes again as Aussie bows out at US Open

image.altText: a man points at a painting of a portrait of a woman dressed in old fashioned clothes

props.synopsis: Portrait of a Lady, a painting of Contessa Colleoni by Italian artist Giuseppe Ghislandi, was looted from Amsterdam-based art dealer Jacques Goudstikker during World War II.

title.children: Painting stolen by Nazis recovered in Argentina, ending 80-year mystery

image.altText: A young woman in a hospital gown sitting on a bed with her face in her hands.

props.synopsis: A survey of Australian women with a condition called hyperemesis gravidarum found more than half considered terminating their pregnancy, and 90 per cent considered having no more children.

title.children: Rebekah had never heard of hyperemesis before it landed her in hospital

image.altText: woman sitting at her computer sipping coffee next to dog

props.synopsis: For people without a spouse or children, choosing someone such as a parent or sibling to leave their superannuation to is not straightforward. Â

title.children: Single without kids? Leaving your super to someone isn't straightforward

image.altText: Close-up photo of clasped hands on lap.

props.synopsis: The sexual assault victimisation rate is now the highest it has been since the ABS began releasing data in 1993.

title.children: Recorded sexual assaults surpass 40,000 nationwide

image.altText: A dead fish on a river bank

props.synopsis: The Anglesea River â a tourism drawcard on the Surf Coast and place of pride for locals â has seen repeat fish kills in recent years, with both residents and experts at a loss as to restore the river's health.

title.children: The neon green river killing fish on Victoria's surf coast
